content: first have outlook installed and functional. Second make it the systems default mail client. Three install Thunderbird when it launches it will offer to import outlook.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
All your issues are about your provider. They have now blocked your account. I have no idea why you are setting anything up. They told you what to do, you did it and now they have blocked your account. What is the next step they suggest . Not contacting anyone about Thunderbird as the fix has to come from them.

Basically sitestar have blocked your IP address for to many failed attempts to send your mail.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Thannk you from this old ladies heart. Contacting Sitestar this morning, the provider of the email I use, now. Waiting to hear from them. I will let you know the results. Thank you so much for responding.
creator: Sunflowr

content:
Contacted Sitestar this morning. After several hours of tests, including being able to send mail thru their webmail site and also being able to send mail from my gmail account, they determined that the issue was a Thunderbird issue and I needed 'email app support'. Whether or not this is true will be determined in the future.

So the good news is that I have still 2 ways to send out email, which is not very often, although replying to an email does not work either.

The option is to uninstall my adorable Thunderbird program and reinstall, but unfortunately when I did that years ago, I lost all my contacts and folders. So I am either going to have to hire someone to do that for me, look on youtube for how to do that, get another email program like Outlook, which I prefer not to do, or just leave it alone.

So I am humorously caught in a loop of A says B did it and B says A did it. If you have any other suggestions, I am very happy to receive. I do make my yearly donation to Thunderbird as I appreciate the work everyone does. So maybe that good karma will come around.
creator: Sunflowr

content:
The recommended settings are:

mail.sitestar.net, port 465, SSL/TLS security, authentication = normal password, User Name = email address

If you have that and still get the 'abuse' error, the only remedy is to ask Sitestar to unblock your account.
creator: sfhowes

content: I finally gave up trying to get Sitestar to unblock the account and just waited for a while. One day I forgot I could not send outan email and sent a reply to someone and it went thru. It appears to have fixed itself. I have yet to initiate an email to see if that gets sent out, so we will see what happens then. Thanks for your reply. I am keeping it just in case this happens again.
creator: Sunflowr

content: You reached us. Now, you need to provide details on whatever the problem is. Screenshots of error messages, plus of your incoming server settings pane and your SMTP server settings pane. Thank you.
creator: davidsk

content:
As david says - we would need to know what the error message says and images of your current server settings.

Located some info: https://www.freeparking.co.nz/help/article/freeparking-email-settings

server name seems to be the same no matter whether Imap Pop or SMTP The Ports do vary and you must use the correct one for the type of protocol.

Imap

  • server name: mailx.freeparking.co.nz
  • Port: 993
  • Connection Security: SSL/TLS
  • Authentication Method: Normal Password
  • Username: usually full email address
  • Password- same one you use to access webmail account

Pop

  • server name: mailx.freeparking.co.nz
  • Port:995
  • Connection Security: SSL/TLS
  • Authentication Method: Normal Password
  • Username: usually full email address
  • Password- same one you use to access webmail account


SMTP They seem to imply they do not offer a secure method of sending which is a bit of a concern to say the least. I would first try the Connection Security using STARTTLS with Authentication 'Normal Password', but the alternative are 'None' using 'password transmitted insecurely'

  • server name: mailx.freeparking.co.nz
  • Port: 587
  • Connection Security: try 'STARTTLS' but info implies no security so 'None'
  • Authentication Method: Normal Password or if 'None' above then 'password transmitted insecurely'
  • Username: usually full email address
  • Password- same one you use to access webmail account
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
I think the 'text file' is actually an mbox file, and it should be able to be imported to TB by simply copying it into the Mail/Local Folders subfolder of the TB profile folder, with TB closed.
